contentList.content: Antimagic Trespasser

You can no longer be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burned</LSTag> by burning surfaces, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SHOCKED_SURFACE">Electrocuted</LSTag> by shocked surfaces, or slip <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE_ICE">Prone</LSTag> on frozen surfaces. You also can't be magically <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralysed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag>.

Spell Purge
You gain the ability to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DispelEvilAndGood_BreakEnchantment">Dispel Evil and Good: Break Enchantment</LSTag>.
Eyes of the Maker
You can see normally in darkness, both magical and non-magical, to a distance of [1], and you can't be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>.
Annulment

Affected entity's magic has been severely impaired by the Rite of Annulment.

It has a [1] penalty to spell attack rolls and Spell Save DC, and Disadvantage on Saving Throws for maintaining Concentration.
Spellbreaker

Spellbreakers stand as steadfast guardians against the arcane, channeling the power of their unique abilities to suppress and counteract magic. They wield both sword and purpose with unwavering conviction.
Spellbane Die
Spellbane dice are spent to empower Spellbreaker abilities, improving anti-magic capabilities in combat.
Spellbane Dice: [3]

Your Spellbane Dice are d4s. You have [3]. At Fighter level 7, these dice become d6s. At Fighter level 11, they become d8s. They fuel your Spellbreaker abilities and are expended upon use. You regain expended Spellbane Dice after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Deny Magic
Deny Magic (Ally)
When an enemy hits you with a spell, spend a spellbane die to reduce the damage by [1]. You must be able to see the attacker.
When an enemy hits an ally within [1] with a spell, spend a spellbane die to reduce the damage by [2]. You must be able to see the attacker.
Spelleater
When you prevent damage with Deny Magic, you gain [1].
When an ally makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against a spell, you can spend a spellbane die to grant them a +[1] bonus.
Weavecutting Smite

Spend a spellbane die to deal an additional [1]. On a hit, the target must also succeed on a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Blocked</LSTag> for 1 turn.
Does not spend <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LyriumDie">spellbane dice</LSTag>.
Rite of Annulment
While it remains in the aura, the creature is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TEMPLAR_ANNULMENT_ANTIMAGIC">Spell Blocked</LSTag>.
Spell Blocked
A Spellbreaker has severed the character's connection to magic, preventing it from casting spells.
Spellbreaker's Counterspell
Make a creature fail when it casts a spell. Spells of level [1] or lower can always be interrupted. Higher level spells are harder and require a <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag>.
Counterspell DC is equal to 10 + the spell's level. In place of any ability modifier, your spellbane die is rolled to add [1] to the Check.
Spend a spellbane die to give an ally a +[1] bonus on an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against a spell.

Break your target's <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silence</LSTag> it for 2 turns. If your target is concentrating or is a supernatural or otherworldly being, deal the maximum possible damage of [1].
Templar Doctrine
Spend a spellbane die to gain a +[1] bonus on Arcana, Religion, and Medicine <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> for 10 turns.
Sacred Chant
Invoke ancient hymns to harness powerful effects. Each chant is a <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> ability that offers unique benefits.
Being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag> will prevent you from chanting. However, chants are not spells and are not affected by antimagic effects like Sussur.
You have a +[1] bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against spells for 10 turns.
When an enemy hits you or a nearby ally with a spell, reduce the damage by [1] as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag>. You must be able to see the attacker.
Gain a +[1] bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against spells for 10 turns.

As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag>, when an ally makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against a spell, grant them a +[1] bonus.

Make a weapon attack that deals an additional [1], breaks your target's <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silence</LSTag> it for 2 turns. If your target is concentrating or is a supernatural or otherworldly being, you deal the maximum possible damage of [2].
Gain a +[1] bonus on Arcana, Religion, and Medicine <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> for 10 turns.
Cleanse Magic
Gain the ability to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Templar_Target_RemoveCurse">Remove Curse</LSTag> with a spellbane die.
Purge Magic
Gain the ability to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Templar_Target_DispelEvilAndGood_BreakEnchantment">Dispel Evil and Good: Break Enchantment</LSTag> with a Lyrium Die.
Censor Magic

You can spend a spellbane die to use Spellbreaker's Counterspell and nullify another creature's spell as a reaction. The spell must be 2nd Level or lower. If it is higher, you must succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> to nullify it. The difficulty is 12 plus the spell's Level.
Improved Spellbane
The size of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LyriumDie">Spellbane Dice</LSTag> increases to 1d6.
The size of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LyriumDie">Spellbane Dice</LSTag> increases to 1d8.
